original_title: And We Knew How to Dance: Women in World War I
overview: This feature documentary profiles 12 Canadian women who entered the male-dominated world of munitions factories and farm labour during World War I. In 1994, aged 86 to 101, these women recall their wartime work experiences and the ways in which their commitment and determination helped lead the way to postwar social changes for women.
title: And We Knew How to Dance: Women in World War I
